intro: Homalobus amblyodon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Homalobus amblyodon is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
